Staff 





Featured stories 

 


Campus news 

Meet the team preserving Stanford’s land, water, and wildlife 
The staff behind the Conservation Program are leading Stanford’s land stewardship efforts to ensure the university’s vast natural landscape and biodiversity can thrive.
1 week ago




 


Climate watch 

Stanford has ambitious campus sustainability goals 
Through various efforts – big and small, seen and unseen – Stanford aims to embody the future of sustainability.
1 week ago




 


campus arts 

Meet the spring quarter visiting artists 
Dozens of guest artists are coming to the Stanford campus this quarter to entertain, delight, provoke, and shed light on global issues.
1 week ago




 


Joy ride 

Stanford Transportation asked readers for great bike commute stories 
When Stanford Transportation asked for great bike commute stories, the anecdotes poured in. Who knew getting to campus by bike was so exciting?
1 week ago






        Staff Events      





More staff events 








          Announcements        



Data security incident: A recent data security incident experienced by a vendor, Brightline, affects Stanford group health plan participants with dependents under the age of 18. The company will begin notifying affected individuals on or around April 7, 2023. 

Stanford Continuing Studies registration is open: Courses are STAP-approved and open to everyone. The quarter starts the week of April 3. Learn more. 



 




COVID policies





 


Surveillance testing for faculty, staff, and postdocs has ended March 24, with the end of winter quarter. Free rapid tests will continue to be provided.





 


Stanford strongly recommends wearing masks indoors, including in classrooms and instructional spaces, and outdoors in crowded settings. Masks continue to be required in healthcare facilities.





 


Community members are encouraged to stay up to date on COVID immunizations, particularly the bivalent booster.
